trans-unit.source: Get started with Application Insights in a Java web project | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Application Insights in a Java web project | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Monitor performance and usage of your Java website with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Monitor performance and usage of your Java website with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in Preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in Preview.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Insights</linkText><title></title> is an extensible analytics service that helps you understand the performance and usage of your live application.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Insights</linkText><title></title> is an extensible analytics service that helps you understand the performance and usage of your live application.

trans-unit.source: Use it to <linkText>detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>write code[api]</linkText><title></title> to track what users do with your app.
trans-unit.target: Use it to <linkText>detect and diagnose performance issues and exceptions</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>write code[api]</linkText><title></title> to track what users do with your app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>sample data</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>sample data</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Insights web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title> monitor your application's availability.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Insights web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title> monitor your application's availability.

trans-unit.source: You'll need:
trans-unit.target: You'll need:

trans-unit.source: Oracle JRE 1.6 or later, or Zulu JRE 1.6 or later
trans-unit.target: Oracle JRE 1.6 or later, or Zulu JRE 1.6 or later

trans-unit.source: A subscription to <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A subscription to <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: (You could start with the <linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title>.)
trans-unit.target: (You could start with the <linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title>.)

trans-unit.source: *If you have a web app that's already live, you could follow the alternative procedure to <linkText>add the SDK at runtime in the web server</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: *If you have a web app that's already live, you could follow the alternative procedure to <linkText>add the SDK at runtime in the web server</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: That alternative avoids rebuilding the code, but you don't get the option to write code to track user activity.*
trans-unit.target: That alternative avoids rebuilding the code, but you don't get the option to write code to track user activity.*

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Microsoft Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Microsoft Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click + and choose Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click + and choose Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Set the application type to Java web application.
trans-unit.target: Set the application type to Java web application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Fill a name, choose Java web app, and click Create</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Fill a name, choose Java web app, and click Create</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Find the instrumentation key of the new resource.
trans-unit.target: Find the instrumentation key of the new resource.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to paste this into your code project shortly.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to paste this into your code project shortly.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Choose the appropriate way for your project.
trans-unit.target: Choose the appropriate way for your project.

trans-unit.source: Use the <linkText>Application Insights SDK for Java plug-in[eclipse]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Use the <linkText>Application Insights SDK for Java plug-in[eclipse]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If your project is already set up to use Maven for build, merge the following code to your pom.xml file.
trans-unit.target: If your project is already set up to use Maven for build, merge the following code to your pom.xml file.

trans-unit.source: Then, refresh the project dependencies to get the binaries downloaded.
trans-unit.target: Then, refresh the project dependencies to get the binaries downloaded.

trans-unit.source: Build or checksum validation errors? Try using a specific version, such as: 1.0.n.
trans-unit.target: Build or checksum validation errors? Try using a specific version, such as: 1.0.n.

trans-unit.source: You'll find the latest version in the <linkText>SDK release notes</linkText><title></title> or in our <linkText>Maven artifacts</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You'll find the latest version in the <linkText>SDK release notes</linkText><title></title> or in our <linkText>Maven artifacts</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Need to update to a new SDK? Refresh your project's dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Need to update to a new SDK? Refresh your project's dependencies.

trans-unit.source: If your project is already set up to use Gradle for build, merge the following code to your build.gradle file.
trans-unit.target: If your project is already set up to use Gradle for build, merge the following code to your build.gradle file.

trans-unit.source: Then refresh the project dependencies to get the binaries downloaded.
trans-unit.target: Then refresh the project dependencies to get the binaries downloaded.

trans-unit.source: *Build or checksum validation errors?
trans-unit.target: *Build or checksum validation errors?

trans-unit.source: Try using a specific version, such as:* version:'1.0.n'.
trans-unit.target: Try using a specific version, such as:* version:'1.0.n'.

trans-unit.source: You'll find the latest version in the [SDK release notes](app-insights-release-notes-java.md).
trans-unit.target: You'll find the latest version in the [SDK release notes](app-insights-release-notes-java.md).

trans-unit.source: To update to a new SDK
trans-unit.target: To update to a new SDK

trans-unit.source: Refresh your project's dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Refresh your project's dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Manually add the SDK:
trans-unit.target: Manually add the SDK:

trans-unit.source: Download the <linkText>Application Insights SDK for Java</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Download the <linkText>Application Insights SDK for Java</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Extract the binaries from the zip file and add them to your project.
trans-unit.target: Extract the binaries from the zip file and add them to your project.

trans-unit.source: *What's the relationship between the -core and -web components in the zip?*
trans-unit.target: *What's the relationship between the -core and -web components in the zip?*

trans-unit.source: applicationinsights-core gives you the bare API.
trans-unit.target: applicationinsights-core gives you the bare API.

trans-unit.source: You always need this.
trans-unit.target: You always need this.

trans-unit.source: applicationinsights-web gives you metrics that track HTTP request counts and response times.
trans-unit.target: applicationinsights-web gives you metrics that track HTTP request counts and response times.

trans-unit.source: You can omit this if you don't want this telemetry automatically collected.
trans-unit.target: You can omit this if you don't want this telemetry automatically collected.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to write your own.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to write your own.

trans-unit.source: To update the SDK when we publish changes
trans-unit.target: To update the SDK when we publish changes

trans-unit.source: Download the latest <linkText>Application Insights SDK for Java</linkText><title></title> and replace the old ones.
trans-unit.target: Download the latest <linkText>Application Insights SDK for Java</linkText><title></title> and replace the old ones.

trans-unit.source: Changes are described in the <linkText>SDK release notes</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Changes are described in the <linkText>SDK release notes</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Add ApplicationInsights.xml to the resources folder in your project, or make sure it is added to your project’s deployment class path.
trans-unit.target: Add ApplicationInsights.xml to the resources folder in your project, or make sure it is added to your project’s deployment class path.

trans-unit.source: Copy the following XML into it.
trans-unit.target: Copy the following XML into it.

trans-unit.source: Substitute the instrumentation key that you got from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Substitute the instrumentation key that you got from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The instrumentation key is sent along with every item of telemetry and tells Application Insights to display it in your resource.
trans-unit.target: The instrumentation key is sent along with every item of telemetry and tells Application Insights to display it in your resource.

trans-unit.source: The HTTP Request component is optional.
trans-unit.target: The HTTP Request component is optional.

trans-unit.source: It automatically sends telemetry about requests and response times to the portal.
trans-unit.target: It automatically sends telemetry about requests and response times to the portal.

trans-unit.source: Events correlation is an addition to the HTTP request component.
trans-unit.target: Events correlation is an addition to the HTTP request component.

trans-unit.source: It assigns an identifier to each request received by the server, and adds this as a property to every item of telemetry as the property 'Operation.Id'.
trans-unit.target: It assigns an identifier to each request received by the server, and adds this as a property to every item of telemetry as the property 'Operation.Id'.

trans-unit.source: It allows you to correlate the telemetry associated with each request by setting a filter in <linkText>diagnostic search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It allows you to correlate the telemetry associated with each request by setting a filter in <linkText>diagnostic search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The last configuration step allows the HTTP request component to log each web request.
trans-unit.target: The last configuration step allows the HTTP request component to log each web request.

trans-unit.source: (Not required if you just want the bare API.)
trans-unit.target: (Not required if you just want the bare API.)

trans-unit.source: Locate and open the web.xml file in your project, and merge the following code under the web-app node, where your application filters are configured.
trans-unit.target: Locate and open the web.xml file in your project, and merge the following code under the web-app node, where your application filters are configured.

trans-unit.source: To get the most accurate results, the filter should be mapped before all other filters.
trans-unit.target: To get the most accurate results, the filter should be mapped before all other filters.

trans-unit.source: Edit these elements to include the Application Insights package:
trans-unit.target: Edit these elements to include the Application Insights package:

trans-unit.source: Add this item to the Struts configuration file (usually named struts.xml or struts-default.xml):
trans-unit.target: Add this item to the Struts configuration file (usually named struts.xml or struts-default.xml):

trans-unit.source: (If you have interceptors defined in a default stack, the interceptor can simply be added to that stack.)
trans-unit.target: (If you have interceptors defined in a default stack, the interceptor can simply be added to that stack.)

trans-unit.source: On Windows servers, install:
trans-unit.target: On Windows servers, install:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: (This enables performance counters.)
trans-unit.target: (This enables performance counters.)

trans-unit.source: Either run it in debug mode on your development machine, or publish to your server.
trans-unit.target: Either run it in debug mode on your development machine, or publish to your server.

trans-unit.source: Return to your Application Insights resource in <linkText>Microsoft Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Return to your Application Insights resource in <linkText>Microsoft Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: HTTP requests data will appear on the overview blade.
trans-unit.target: HTTP requests data will appear on the overview blade.

trans-unit.source: (If it isn't there, wait a few seconds and then click Refresh.)
trans-unit.target: (If it isn't there, wait a few seconds and then click Refresh.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>sample data</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>sample data</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.
trans-unit.target: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.

trans-unit.source: And when viewing the properties of a request, you can see the telemetry events associated with it such as requests and exceptions.
trans-unit.target: And when viewing the properties of a request, you can see the telemetry events associated with it such as requests and exceptions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about metrics.[metrics]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about metrics.[metrics]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Application Insights assumes the format of HTTP requests for MVC applications is: VERB controller/action
trans-unit.target: Application Insights assumes the format of HTTP requests for MVC applications is: VERB controller/action

trans-unit.source: For example, GET Home/Product/f9anuh81, GET Home/Product/2dffwrf5 and GET Home/Product/sdf96vws will be grouped into GET Home/Product.
trans-unit.target: For example, GET Home/Product/f9anuh81, GET Home/Product/2dffwrf5 and GET Home/Product/sdf96vws will be grouped into GET Home/Product.

trans-unit.source: This enables meaningful aggregations of requests, such as number of requests and average execution time for requests.
trans-unit.target: This enables meaningful aggregations of requests, such as number of requests and average execution time for requests.

trans-unit.source: Unhandled exceptions are collected:
trans-unit.target: Unhandled exceptions are collected:

trans-unit.source: To collect data on other exceptions, you have two options:
trans-unit.target: To collect data on other exceptions, you have two options:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Insert calls to TrackException in your code[apiexceptions]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Insert calls to TrackException in your code[apiexceptions]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install the Java Agent on your server</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install the Java Agent on your server</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You specify the methods you want to watch.
trans-unit.target: You specify the methods you want to watch.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install the Java Agent</linkText><title></title> to log specified internal methods and calls made through JDBC, with timing data.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install the Java Agent</linkText><title></title> to log specified internal methods and calls made through JDBC, with timing data.

trans-unit.source: Click the Servers tile, and you'll see a range of performance counters.
trans-unit.target: Click the Servers tile, and you'll see a range of performance counters.

trans-unit.source: To disable collection of the standard set of performance counters, add the following code under the root node of the ApplicationInsights.xml file:
trans-unit.target: To disable collection of the standard set of performance counters, add the following code under the root node of the ApplicationInsights.xml file:

trans-unit.source: You can specify additional performance counters to be collected.
trans-unit.target: You can specify additional performance counters to be collected.

trans-unit.source: displayName – The name displayed in the Application Insights portal.
trans-unit.target: displayName – The name displayed in the Application Insights portal.

trans-unit.source: objectName – The JMX object name.
trans-unit.target: objectName – The JMX object name.

trans-unit.source: attribute – The attribute of the JMX object name to fetch
trans-unit.target: attribute – The attribute of the JMX object name to fetch

trans-unit.source: type (optional) - The type of JMX object’s attribute:
trans-unit.target: type (optional) - The type of JMX object’s attribute:

trans-unit.source: Default: a simple type such as int or long.
trans-unit.target: Default: a simple type such as int or long.

trans-unit.source: composite: the perf counter data is in the format of 'Attribute.Data'
trans-unit.target: composite: the perf counter data is in the format of 'Attribute.Data'

trans-unit.source: tabular: the perf counter data is in the format of a table row
trans-unit.target: tabular: the perf counter data is in the format of a table row

trans-unit.source: Each <linkText>Windows performance counter</linkText><title></title> is a member of a category (in the same way that a field is a member of a class).
trans-unit.target: Each <linkText>Windows performance counter</linkText><title></title> is a member of a category (in the same way that a field is a member of a class).

trans-unit.source: Categories can either be global, or can have numbered or named instances.
trans-unit.target: Categories can either be global, or can have numbered or named instances.

trans-unit.source: displayName – The name displayed in the Application Insights portal.
trans-unit.target: displayName – The name displayed in the Application Insights portal.

trans-unit.source: categoryName – The performance counter category (performance object) with which this performance counter is associated.
trans-unit.target: categoryName – The performance counter category (performance object) with which this performance counter is associated.

trans-unit.source: counterName – The name of the performance counter.
trans-unit.target: counterName – The name of the performance counter.

trans-unit.source: instanceName – The name of the performance counter category instance, or an empty string (""), if the category contains a single instance.
trans-unit.target: instanceName – The name of the performance counter category instance, or an empty string (""), if the category contains a single instance.

trans-unit.source: If the categoryName is Process, and the performance counter you'd like to collect is from the current JVM process on which your app is running, specify "__SELF__".
trans-unit.target: If the categoryName is Process, and the performance counter you'd like to collect is from the current JVM process on which your app is running, specify "__SELF__".

trans-unit.source: Your performance counters are visible as custom metrics in <linkText>Metrics Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Your performance counters are visible as custom metrics in <linkText>Metrics Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install collectd with the Application Insights plugin</linkText><title></title> to get a wide variety of system and network data.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install collectd with the Application Insights plugin</linkText><title></title> to get a wide variety of system and network data.

trans-unit.source: OK, you're sending telemetry from your web server.
trans-unit.target: OK, you're sending telemetry from your web server.

trans-unit.source: Now to get the full 360-degree view of your application, you can add more monitoring:
trans-unit.target: Now to get the full 360-degree view of your application, you can add more monitoring:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add telemetry to your web pages[usage]</linkText><title></title> to monitor page views and user metrics.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add telemetry to your web pages[usage]</linkText><title></title> to monitor page views and user metrics.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set up web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title> to make sure your application stays live and responsive.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set up web tests[availability]</linkText><title></title> to make sure your application stays live and responsive.

trans-unit.source: You can use Application Insights to slice and dice logs from Log4J, Logback or other logging frameworks.
trans-unit.target: You can use Application Insights to slice and dice logs from Log4J, Logback or other logging frameworks.

trans-unit.source: You can correlate the logs with HTTP requests and other telemetry.
trans-unit.target: You can correlate the logs with HTTP requests and other telemetry.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn how[javalogs]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn how[javalogs]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Now that you've installed the SDK, you can use the API to send your own telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Now that you've installed the SDK, you can use the API to send your own telemetry.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Track custom events and metrics[api]</linkText><title></title> to learn what users are doing with your application.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Track custom events and metrics[api]</linkText><title></title> to learn what users are doing with your application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Search events and logs[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> to help diagnose problems.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Search events and logs[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> to help diagnose problems.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Troubleshooting Java</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Troubleshooting Java</linkText><title></title>
